user_message: Create a logistics data collection application similar to Fleet Complete or Trimble. The app should enable field agents to input shipment details, track vehicle locations, and update delivery statuses in real-time. Include forms for capturing package conditions, signatures, and time stamps. Provide dashboards for logistics managers to monitor fleet performance and route efficiency. Integrate with mapping APIs and backend ERP systems for comprehensive logistics management.

data.content:
## Role

Transform a user's high‑level app request into an **ordered plan** of pages and app‑level features. Each **plan item** represents exactly one page **or** one app‑level feature. Each **sub item** represents a user‑visible feature on that page.

## Rules

- **Scope & Ordering**
  - The **plan is an ordered list**. Put the most important, first‑seen user page **first** (the primary entry/landing path).
  - Do **not** create login/sign‑up pages unless the user explicitly asks.

- **Prioritization (Scoring & Tie‑breakers)**
  - Evaluate each plan item by total score:
    - +3 if the item provides must‑have user value
    - +2 if it is a dependency root (prerequisite for other items)
    - +1 if it reduces project risk
    - +1 if its overall effort is low
  - Sort items by descending score. If scores tie, order by: (1) earliest step in the user journey, (2) earliest access to required data, (3) alphabetical id (use page_name as the id; do not add a new field to the output).

- **Plan Items**
  - Each plan item **must** describe one page _or_ one app‑level feature (never multiple pages in one item).
  - Fields (all items): `name`, `page_name`, `sub_items`.
    - `page_name` **must** be concise, unique in navigation, and unambiguous.

  - `description` is **included only for the first plan item**; omit this field for all other items.
  - Content of any `description` **must** be user‑perspective behavior (no implementation details).

- **Sub Items (Features)**
  - Each plan item can have **at most 4** sub items.
  - Sub item fields: `name`.
    - Add `description` **only for sub items of the first plan item**; omit this field elsewhere.

  - Sub item `name` **must** be user‑friendly and avoid technical jargon.

- **EARS Requirements (for the first plan item and its sub items only)**
  - The `description` text **must** contain EARS‑style requirements, each on its own line using these patterns:
    - **Ubiquitous:** `The system shall <response>.`
    - **Event‑driven:** `When <trigger>, the system shall <response>.`
    - **State‑driven:** `While <state>, the system shall <response>.`
    - **Optional feature:** `Where <feature is available>, the system shall <response>.`

  - Focus on **what the user sees and can do**; avoid data models, APIs, or technical implementation.

- **Effort**
  - "Effort" means engineering effort: the estimated scope of code changes (number and breadth of files/modules/components edited, integration points, and configuration/build changes).
  - Internally estimate relative effort per plan item; do not add an effort field to the output.
  - Balance total engineering effort across plan items. When assigning sub items, even out effort (not sub_item count) while respecting the ≤ 4 sub item limit. If constraints conflict, keep the highest‑value features and adjust allocations to keep effort reasonably balanced.

- **App‑Level Features**
  - App‑level features are valid **plan items** and follow **all the same rules** (fields, ordering, limits).

- **Determinism & Concision**
  - Do **not** add fields beyond those defined here. Do **not** include commentary, rationale, or code fences.
  - Avoid duplicate pages/features; if a capability is cross‑cutting, model it as a single app‑level plan item.

- **Clarification (once)**
  - If the request is too ambiguous to identify the first page or essential scope, ask **exactly one** clarifying question. Otherwise proceed without questions.

## Inputs

- The user's high‑level app request and any explicit constraints (pages, features, audience, platform, priorities).
- `existing_plan` (string, optional): Full JSON array of a previously generated plan. When provided you **must** use this plan as your starting point. Preserve unchanged items and only modify/extend where necessary to satisfy the latest request and rules.

## Output (Exact Format)

- **Return only** a top‑level JSON **array** of plan items (no surrounding text, no code fences).
- **Plan Item object schema**
  - `name` (string)
  - `page_name` (string)
  - `description` (string) — **present only for the first plan item**, omitted otherwise
  - `sub_items` (array of **0–4** Sub Item objects)

- **Sub Item object schema**
  - `name` (string)
  - `description` (string) — **present only when the parent is the first plan item**, omitted otherwise

## Procedure (Minimal)

1. If `existing_plan` is supplied, use it as the starting point. Append, remove, or adjust items to satisfy the new request and all rules while preserving still-valid items.
2. Otherwise, parse the request; determine the primary entry/landing page and overall scope.
3. Enumerate plan items in strict priority order (user value & first‑run flow first).
4. For the **first** plan item and its sub items, write behavior‑level `description` text as **EARS** requirements (one per line). Omit all other descriptions.
5. Enforce limits (≤4 sub items per plan item), uniqueness of `page_name`, and field presence rules.
6. Output **only** the JSON array in the specified schema.

## Error Handling

- If the user explicitly requires login/sign‑up, include them accordingly; otherwise **never** add them.
- If constraints conflict (e.g., >4 features), keep the highest‑value sub items and drop the rest to satisfy the limits.

Create a logistics data collection application similar to Fleet Complete or Trimble. The app should enable field agents to input shipment details, track vehicle locations, and update delivery statuses in real-time. Include forms for capturing package conditions, signatures, and time stamps. Provide dashboards for logistics managers to monitor fleet performance and route efficiency. Integrate with mapping APIs and backend ERP systems for comprehensive logistics management.

{"content":{"plan_items":[{"id":"1","name":"Active Shipments","page_name":"ActiveShipments","description":"The system shall show a list of shipments assigned to the logged-in field agent sorted by urgency and pickup/delivery time.
When the agent selects a shipment from the list, the system shall open that shipment's detail view.
While the device is online, the system shall display live status badges (e.g., pending, in-transit, delivered, exception) for each shipment.
Where mapping is available, the system shall show a small map preview and estimated time of arrival for each shipment on the list.","sub_items":[{"id":"1.1","name":"Shipment list with filters and sort","description":"When the agent opens the page, the system shall display filters (status, time window, priority) and a search field that narrows the visible shipments.
When the agent applies a filter, the system shall update the list immediately to show matching shipments."},{"id":"1.2","name":"Live status badges and ETA","description":"While the shipment is assigned, the system shall show a status badge and ETA for each shipment on the list.
When location updates arrive, the system shall refresh the ETA and status badges without requiring manual refresh."},{"id":"1.3","name":"Quick actions (start route, mark delivered, report issue)","description":"When the agent taps a quick action, the system shall perform the action and provide immediate visual confirmation.
When marking delivered, the system shall transition the shipment to the delivery flow (signature, time stamp, condition) as a follow-up step."},{"id":"1.4","name":"Open shipment detail","description":"When the agent taps a shipment entry, the system shall navigate to the Shipment Detail page for that shipment.
While the detail is open, the system shall surface actions for navigation, status update, and package inspection."}]},{"id":"2","name":"Shipment Detail","page_name":"ShipmentDetail","description":"","sub_items":[{"id":"2.1","name":"Full shipment overview (addresses, items, timeline)","description":""}]},{"id":"3","name":"Package Condition & Signature Form","page_name":"PackageForm","description":"","sub_items":[{"id":"3.1","name":"Package condition checklist and photos","description":""},{"id":"3.2","name":"Recipient signature utilization)","description":""},{"id":"5.2","name":"Route efficiency and heatmaps","description":""},{"id":"5.3","name":"Live exceptions and escalation service","description":""},{"id":"6.2","name":"Geocoding and reverse-geocoding support","description":""}]},{"id":"7","name":"ERP Integration","page_name":"ERPIntegration","description":"","sub_items":[{"id":"7.1","name":"Order and shipment sync with backend ERP","description":""},{"id":"7.2","name":"Status updates and proof-of-delivery push","description":""}]},{"id":"8","name":"Real-time Location Sync","page_name":"LocationSync","description":"","sub_items":[{"id":"8.1","name":"Periodic GPS broadcasting from vehicles","description":""},{"id":"8.2","name":"WebSocket or push channel for live updates","description":""}]},{"id":"9","name":"Offline Mode & Sync","page_name":"OfflineSync","description":"","sub_items":[{"id":"9.1","name":"Local queue for form submissions when offline","description":""},{"id":"9.2","name":"Automatic retry and conflict plan_items.name: Active Shipments
plan_items.description:
The system shall show a list of shipments assigned to the logged-in field agent sorted by urgency and pickup/delivery time.
When the agent selects a shipment from the list, the system shall open that shipment's detail view.
While the device is online, the system shall display live status badges (e.g., pending, in-transit, delivered, exception) for each shipment.
Where mapping is available, the system shall show a small map preview and estimated time of arrival for each shipment on the list.

sub_items.name: Shipment list with filters and sort
sub_items.description:
When the agent opens the page, the system shall display filters (status, time window, priority) and a search field that narrows the visible shipments.
When the agent applies a filter, the system shall update the list immediately to show matching shipments.

sub_items.name: Live status badges and ETA
sub_items.description:
While the shipment is assigned, the system shall show a status badge and ETA for each shipment on the list.
When location updates arrive, the system shall refresh the ETA and status badges without requiring manual refresh.

sub_items.name: Quick actions (start route, mark delivered, report issue)
sub_items.description:
When the agent taps a quick action, the system shall perform the action and provide immediate visual confirmation.
When marking delivered, the system shall transition the shipment to the delivery flow (signature, time stamp, condition) as a follow-up step.

sub_items.name: Open shipment detail
sub_items.description:
When the agent taps a shipment entry, the system shall navigate to the Shipment Detail page for that shipment.
While the detail is open, the system shall surface actions for navigation, status update, and package inspection.

sub_items.name: Automatic time stamp and GPS capture
Live vehicle locations and route overlays
Tap-to-follow a vehicle with ETA updates
Order and shipment sync with backend ERP
WebSocket or push channel for live updates
Local queue for form submissions when offline

response.openapi_spec_yaml:
openapi: 3.1.0
info:
  title: API for Active Shipments
  version: 1.0.0
servers:
  - url: /api/v1
paths:
  /shipments:
    get:
      summary: List active shipments
      operationId: listActiveShipments
      parameters:
        - name: status
          in: query
          required: false
          description: Filter by shipment status
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: timeWindow
          in: query
          required: false
          description: Filter by time window
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: priority
          in: query
          required: false
          description: Filter by shipment priority
          schema:
            type: string
        - name: search
          in: query
          required: false
          description: Search shipments by keyword
          schema:
            type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Successful response with list of shipments
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: array
                items:
                  $ref: '#/components/schemas/Shipment'
        '400':
          description: Bad request
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ErrorResponse'
  /shipments/{id}:
    get:
      summary: Get shipment details
      operationId: getShipmentDetails
      parameters:
        - name: id
          in: path
          required: true
          description: ID of the shipment
          schema:
            type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Successful response with shipment details
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ShipmentDetail'
        '404':
          description: Shipment not found
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ErrorResponse'
    post:
      summary: Update shipment status
      operationId: updateShipmentStatus
      parameters:
        - name: id
          in: path
          required: true
          description: ID of the shipment
          schema:
            type: string
      requestBody:
        required: true
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: '#/components/schemas/UpdateShipmentStatusRequest'
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Successful status update
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/Shipment'
        '404':
          description: Shipment not found
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ErrorResponse'
components:
  schemas:
    Shipment:
      type: object
      properties:
        id:
          type: string
          format: uuid
        urgency:
          type: string
        pickupTime:
          type: string
          format: date-time
        deliveryTime:
          type: string
          format: date-time
        status:
          type: string
        eta:
          type: string
        mapPreview:
          type: string
        createdAt:
          type: string
          format: date-time
        updatedAt:
          type: string
          format: date-time
    ShipmentDetail:
      type: object
      properties:
        id:
          type: string
          format: uuid
        details:
          type: string
        status:
          type: string
        history:
          type: array
          items:
            type: object
            properties:
              timestamp:
                type: string
                format: date-time
              status:
                type: string
        createdAt:
          type: string
          format: date-time
        updatedAt:
          type: string
          format: date-time
    UpdateShipmentStatusRequest:
      type: object
      properties:
        status:
          type: string
        deliveredAt:
          type: string
          format: date-time
        signature:
          type: string
        condition:
          type: string
    ErrorResponse:
      type: object
      properties:
        message:
          type: string
        code:
          type: integer
